answers.value: The writer means that the use of technology is increasing at a rapid rate.
These methods have been tried and tested. These methods will work successfully.

questions.text: Open-ended question on popularity of storytelling

positives: It will remain popular because it helps people to maintain bonds with each other. It adds a human touch and is an effective way of keeping emotional ties strong.
negatives: The popularity of storytelling will eventually decrease as more people embrace technology. Oral tradition will thus lose its impact.

questions.marker_instruction: Accept other suitable answers. A candidate can score 1 mark for an answer that is not well-substantiated. Accept a combination answer.

questions.text: Open-ended question on suitability of title 'Power of Storytelling'

positives: It is suitable because the passage reveals how storytelling impacts different aspects of human experience. The word 'power' implies that storytelling is an effective art form. Through storytelling, cultural beliefs and values are communicated from one generation to the next.
negatives: While storytelling is viewed as an effective art form, calling it powerful is an exaggeration. For some people storytelling is an outdated and ineffective practice.

questions.marker_instruction: Accept other suitable answers. A candidate can score 1 mark for an answer that is not well-substantiated. Accept a combination answer.

Western Cape and Eastern Cape.

questions.text: Open-ended question on the necessity of the graph key

positives: The key provides the names of the provinces as only abbreviations are used in the graph. Without this information, it will be difficult to determine what each of the abbreviations stands for.
negatives: Everyone knows what these abbreviations stand for. The graph can be interpreted without the key.

questions.marker_instruction: Marking is on the basis of the inclusion of valid material and the exclusion of invalid material. 7 marks for 7 points (1 mark per main point), 3 marks for language. Language marks: 1-3 points (1 mark), 4-5 points (2 marks), 6-7 points (3 marks). If quoted verbatim: 6-7 quotes (0 language marks), 4-5 quotes (max 1 mark), 2-3 quotes (max 2 marks). Word count: verify number of words; read up to the limit and ignore the rest.

questions.text: Open-ended question on effectiveness of advertisement

positives: The product has been scientifically proven to work. It is alcohol free. It is three times more effective (parodontax targets 3x more plaque.) It is available in two variants. It claims to keep your gums and teeth healthy.
negatives: The product focuses on gum health and not all people care about the health of their gums. There are only two variants therefore the advertisement will not appeal to many people.
